info.game_comments:
2001 Teen Tournament quarterfinal game 3.
From the Pennsylvania Convention Center in Philadelphia.

(2, 1).clue: This 25-year-old golfer holds the tournament records for low scores at the Masters, U.S. Open & British Open

(3, 1).clue: In an orchestra, horns like the trumpets & trombones belong to this section of instruments

(4, 1).clue: Coal & crow are shades of this color

(5, 1).clue: This African river's drainage basin, the world's longest, covers 35 degrees of latitude

(6, 1).clue: In law, when you're doing something that's offensive to the community, you're a public this

(2, 2).clue: (Hi, I'm Charles Barkley)  In 1993 I was named the league's MVP while with this team whose name reflects its year-round tropical climate

(3, 2).clue: Praise the Lord!  This Handel oratorio includes the famous "Hallelujah Chorus"

(4, 2).clue: Barbie's boy toy, in March 2001 he celebrated his 40th birthday

(5, 2).clue: In area this Canadian bay is more than 3 times as large as all the Great Lakes combined

(6, 2).clue: NBA team that makes its home at 1000 Chopper Circle, Denver, Colorado

(2, 3).clue: Known as "The Intimidator", he was killed in a tragic accident on the final lap of the Daytona 500 on Feb. 18, 2001

(3, 3).clue: Popular in the early 1900s, it's the style of music & piano playing heard here

(4, 3).clue: The Girl Scout badge seen here represents fun with this machine

(5, 3).clue: At the point where it enters the Caspian Sea, this Russian river is 92 feet below sea level

(6, 3).clue: Referring to the things going on at a marriage ceremony, they may be impending

(2, 4).clue: This Green Bay Packers quarterback was named the NFL's Most Valuable Player 3 years in a row, 1995-97

(3, 4).clue: Italian for "in chapel style", it's the term for singing without instrumental accompaniment

(4, 4).clue: The barn variety of this bird doesn't give a hoot, but rather a raspy, hissing screech

(5, 4).clue: Colombia's Gulf of Uraba is the southernmost extremity of this sea

(6, 4).clue: Meaning "stupid", it's how Moe referred to Larry or Curly

(2, 5).clue: In 2000 Stacy Dragila set a women's world record in this track & field event: 15 feet, 2 1/4 inches

(3, 5).clue: He composed the holiday favorite heard here

(4, 5).clue: Seen here is a Byzantine mosaic of this pope & apostle

(5, 5).clue: Large banks of pearl-producing mollusks are found on this gulf's western shore on the Arabian Peninsula

(6, 5).clue: It's a family group of a father, mother & children (not necessarily radioactive)

(1, 1).clue: On July 4, 1776 this head of the Army was in New York preparing for a British attack

(2, 1).clue: A college student in real life, Zhang Ziyi played the daughter of a nobleman in this 2000 film

(4, 1).clue: A name for a class of French fighter jets comes from this term meaning a desert optical illusion

(5, 1).clue: This poem begins, "Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered weak and weary..."

(6, 1).clue: It's the type of speech Al Gore gave about a month after George W. Bush wanted to hear it

(1, 2).clue: The musical "1776" includes the song "Sit Down, John", addressed to this gabby guy from Massachusetts

(2, 2).clue: The Aussie teen film "Blackrock" introduced this young hunk who played Mel Gibson's son in "The Patriot"

(4, 2).clue: Originally flown August 27, 1939, the world's first jet plane was the Heinkel He 178 from this country

(6, 2).clue: By definition, it's an injury to the brain caused by a jarring blow

(1, 3).clue: Army doctor Benjamin Rush believed in the "depletion" of this, sometimes removing 80% of it from a patient

(2, 3).clue: The new Broadway musical "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" features Kristen Bell as this young lady

(4, 3).clue: Weighing over 315 tons, the 747 made by this company is the world's largest commercial jet

(5, 3).clue: The poetry of Attila Jozsef, immortalizing his washerwoman mother, is a monument of this language

(1, 4).clue: Samuel "Bacon Face" Chase became a justice of this 20 years after signing the Declaration of Independence

(4, 4).clue: Occuring at high altitudes, it's the jet engine by-product seen here

(1, 5).clue: The last hour of this patriot is seen here

(0, 0).clue: Of 60 battles fought in the U.S. Civil War, 55 were commanded on both sides by graduates of this school
